revised_title: Female Savannah Sparrows Prefer Males Providing Parental Care
tldr: Using DNA fingerprinting, the study found that female Savannah Sparrows prefer males that provide parental care. The extent of male parental care in the first brood was a strong predictor of female fidelity in the second brood, suggesting that females base their mating decisions on male genetic quality and paternal effort.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Animal Behavior
